definition: a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]
dawn/morning/daybreak/day/dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
day and night/period of 24 hours/continuously, without stop
nocturnal/to hide by day and come out at night
lit. to make night as day (idiom); fig. to burn the midnight oil/work especially hard
to make day as night (idiom, from Book of Songs); fig. to prolong one's pleasure regardless of the hour
day and night (to toil, to abandon oneself to pleasure etc)
to travel at night and lie low by day (idiom)
Zai Yu sleeps by day (idiom); refers to story in Analects of Confucius remonstrating bitterly with his student for sleeping during lectures
the winter days are short and the nights long (idiom)

sentences.english: Lens ark and under the ark of perfect collocation, let beauty regardless of the dayside and night.
sentences.chinese: 镜柜与下柜的完美搭配，让美丽不分昼与夜。

sentences.english: Good ar. why not take the sunset photo, should be good too.
sentences.chinese: 因为个日下昼唔得闲，所以冇影到日落。

sentences.english: Once the cargo is unloaded, it will be subject to the usual customs procedures.
sentences.chinese: 货物一经卸下，遨生昼办理例行的海关手续。

sentences.english: He called the light Day and the darkness Night.
And God called the light Day， and the darkness he called Night.

definition: late at night/in the dead of night
